content: The Family of Elkanah
Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the mountains of Ephraim, and his name  Elkanah the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
And he had two wives: the name of one  Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
This man went up from his city yearly to worship and sacrifice to the  of hosts in Shiloh. Also the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the ,  there.
And whenever the time came for Elkanah to make an offering, he would give portions to Peninnah his wife and to all her sons and daughters.
But to Hannah he would give a double portion, for he loved Hannah, although the  had closed her womb.
And her rival also provoked her severely, to make her miserable, because the  had closed her womb.
So it was, year by year, when she went up to the house of the , that she provoked her; therefore she wept and did not eat.
Hannah’s Vow
Then Elkanah her husband said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep? Why do you not eat? And why is your heart grieved?  I not better to you than ten sons?”
So Hannah arose after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh. Now Eli the priest was sitting on the seat by the doorpost of the tabernacle of the .
And she  in bitterness of soul, and prayed to the  and wept in anguish.

Then she made a vow and said, “O  of hosts, if You will indeed look on the affliction of Your maidservant and remember me, and not forget Your maidservant, but will give Your maidservant a male child, then I will give him to the  all the days of his life, and no razor shall come upon his head.”
And it happened, as she continued praying before the , that Eli watched her mouth.
Now Hannah spoke in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she was drunk.
So Eli said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Put your wine away from you!”
But Hannah answered and said, “No, my lord, I  a woman of sorrowful spirit. I have drunk neither wine nor intoxicating drink, but have poured out my soul before the .
Do not consider your maidservant a wicked woman, for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief I have spoken until now.”
Then Eli answered and said, “Go in peace, and the God of Israel grant your petition which you have asked of Him.”
And she said, “Let your maidservant find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and ate, and her face was no longer
Samuel Is Born and Dedicated
Then they rose early in the morning and worshiped before the , and returned and came to their house at Ramah. And Elkanah knew Hannah his wife, and the  remembered her.
So it came to pass in the process of time that Hannah conceived and bore a son, and called his name Samuel,  “Because I have asked for him from the .”
Now the man Elkanah and all his house went up to offer to the  the yearly sacrifice and his vow.
But Hannah did not go up, for she said to her husband, “ until the child is weaned; then I will take him, that he may appear before the  and remain there forever.”
So Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what seems best to you; wait until you have weaned him. Only let the  establish His word.” Then the woman stayed and nursed her son until she had weaned him.
Now when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, one ephah of flour, and a skin of wine, and brought him to the house of the  in Shiloh. And the child  young.
Then they slaughtered a bull, and brought the child to Eli.
And she said, “O my lord! As your soul lives, my lord, I  the woman who stood by you here, praying to the .
For this child I prayed, and the  has granted me my petition which I asked of Him.
Therefore I also have lent him to the ; as long as he lives he shall be lent to the .” So they worshiped the  there.
